quote_last: the owner’s young wife came, carrying a handleless cup and a pot with a quilted cover, to where I was still lying disconsolate.
title: A Single Pebble
author: John Hershey

quote_first: The next day was Saturday and, now that Moon was done, I decided to bring the job to its end. So I sent word that I shouldn’t be able to umpire for the team at Steeple Sinderby and, after working through the morning, came down
title: A Month in the Country
author: J.L. Carr

quote_first: The express departed from Birmingham with the nicest exactitude, and covered itself with glory as far as Watford, when it ran into a mist, and lost more than a quarter of an hour, besides ruining Arthur’s career. Arthur arrived in London at
title: Catching the Train
author: Arnold Bennet
